KnowledgeBase.Title: stdevp
KnowledgeBase.HumanKeywords: standard deviation distribution population curve displacement mean

Function.Description: The stdevp function computes the standard deviation of a populationbased on the values of the entire population specified in the argument list.

Brief.Overview: The stdevp function computes the standard deviation of a population based on the values of the entire population specified in the argument list. Standard deviation measures the spread or dispersion of values from the mean.
Brief.Usage: The stdevp function is suitable for calculating the standard deviation for an entire population of values. If only a sample of values from a population is available, use the stdev function.

Syntax.Return: Returns the standard deviation of a population based on the values of the entire population specified in the argument list
